H0.text: In 2015 Edgar Lungu became prime minister of. Zimbabwe

H1.text: In 2015 Edgar Lungu became prime minister of. Botswana

H2.text: In 2015 Edgar Lungu became prime minister of. Malawi

H3.text: In 2015 Edgar Lungu became prime minister of. Zambia

A4.text: Edgar Chagwa Lungu (11 November 1956 â€“ 5 June 2025) was a Zambian politician who served as the sixth president of Zambia from 26 January 2015 to 24 August 2021.

A5.text: Lungu was sworn in as President of Zambia on 26 January 2015 at the National Heroes Stadium in the capital Lusaka.

A6.text: President Lungu confident of being re-elected

A7.text: At the 2015 Zambian presidential election, the PF's Edgar Lungu won the presidency.

A8.text: He won 48.33% of the vote, a lead of 1.66% over his closest rival, Hakainde Hichilema, with 46.67%.

A9.text: Edgar Chagwa Lungu was sworn in as president of Zambia on 25 January 2015.

A10.text: He was sworn in as president on 25 January 2015, succeeding acting-president Guy Scott.
